info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 7:02PM EDT until May 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains due to thunderstorms moving into the metro areas of Palm Beach and Northern Broward Counties. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over this area from the morning showers and thunderstorms. These new thunderstorms will be capable of producing another 1 to 3 inches of rainfall. These new rainfall amounts could lead to more minor flooding across the area. - If these rainfall amounts are more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, West Palm Beach, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Tamarac, Wellington, Margate, Lake Worth, Lighthouse Point, Palm Beach, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Highland Beach and Ocean Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING
